column4: hi, i get a kernel panic (attempted to kill init) when i try to boot into the amd64 livecd on an amd turion
eeek   what error with the panic ?
does it have to do with amd64/
i dont know, what reason did it give other than trying to kill init....   what preceeded that ?
i forgot... sorry
mabye its not synching

normally 'trying to kill init' means that init opened as a shell and you are now exiting that shell   the initrd.img can do that but normally the preceeding text to the panic helps understand what is happening.   try to boot with appended quiet=off and verbos  maybe...
thanks...
also hit the f keys and see if there is a boot option for your hardware.  i haven't yet gotten the cd's so i'll have to shoot in the dark a bit longer.
hmm... ill try that if my sis lets me use her laptop to install ubuntu...
yeah normally there are some help pages avalable at the boot prompt  f1  to start with.
what error ?
sudo dpkg --force-all --purge package   ?
i tried sudo dpkg --force- -r libc6 and now commands like ls and sudo dont work
and that errored out because there was no agr to the force agr..... man dpkg
it's not  --force- blah.   it's --force-<agr>     where arg might be   all
what happens when the ubuntu installer runs grub-install hd0 when grub is already in the mbr?
it just over-writes the mbr
will that be damaging?
see the links for !dualboot  and  !grub   check the wiki on that
no it should'nt be
i sent you to the wiki to see what people have to recover from after installing grub and windows in both orders.    you may not have any other os.... if not it can't hurt a thing.
